languages.text:
{n}При виде Маражая Арлекин издает недобрый смешок:{/n}
"Ловец, застрявший в собственных силках!
Сценарий твоей пьесы был неплох,
Но Назракей финал переписал,
Что оговорен был во тьме кулис.
Средь темных шпилей и охотник дичь —
Полезно оглянуться лишний раз,
Не появилось ли в спине ножа,
Что миг назад сверкал в твоей руке".

{n}At the sight of Marazhai, the Harlequin lets out a nasty chuckle:{/n}
"The trapper caught in snares of his own make!
The plotting of your play was up to snuff,
But Nazrakhei rewrote the denouement
Decided in the darkness of the wings.
Amidst the sombre spires and hunter's game,
'Tis wise to stop and once more check your knives—
For that which glittered in your hand before
You may now find a-twinkling in your back."
languages.original_text:

languages.text:
{n}マラズハイを見ると、ハーレクィンは意地悪くくすくす笑う。{/n}
「罠の仕掛け人が己の罠にはまるとは！
その劇の筋書きはまずまず、
だけどナズラクヘイが結末を書きかえた
舞台袖の闇で決めたこと。
陰気な尖塔と狩人の遊びのまっただ中、
手を止めてもう一度ナイフを調べるのが賢明…
あなたの手の中でぎらつくナイフが
その背中できらめくことだってあり得るのだから」
languages.original_text:
{n}At the sight of Marazhai, the Harlequin lets out a nasty chuckle:{/n}
"The trapper caught in snares of his own make!
The plotting of your play was up to snuff,
But Nazrakhei rewrote the denouement
Decided in the darkness of the wings.
Amidst the sombre spires and hunter's game,
'Tis wise to stop and once more check your knives—
For that which glittered in your hand before
You may now find a-twinkling in your back."

その背中できらめくことだってあり得るのだから」

languages.text:
{n}看到玛拉斋之后，丑角爆发出恶毒的轻笑。{/n}
“有人搬起石头，砸中了自己的脚！
你写的剧本也可勉强称好，
但纳札骸挥起黑暗的双翼，
为这故事的结局重新操刀。
在阴沉的尖塔与猎人的游戏里，
别忘了时刻检查你的武器。
上一秒还在你手中闪烁的利刃，
下一秒就已正中你的背脊。”
languages.original_text:
{n}At the sight of Marazhai, the Harlequin lets out a nasty chuckle:{/n}
"The trapper caught in snares of his own make!
The plotting of your play was up to snuff,

languages.text:
{n}L'Arlequin laisse échapper un rire moqueur à la vue de Marazhai :{/n}
« Le trappeur, pris dans ses propres collets,
Malgré la qualité de l'intrigue de sa pièce,
Mais son dénouement Nazrakhei a changé
Dans les coulisses aux ténèbres épaisses.
Parmi les sombres tours et les jeux du chasseur,
Il est sage de s'assurer d'avoir encore ses couteaux,
Car leurs lames qui renvoyaient mille lueurs,
Pourraient bien finir plantées dans votre dos. »
languages.original_text:
{n}At the sight of Marazhai, the Harlequin lets out a nasty chuckle:{/n}
"The trapper caught in snares of his own make!
The plotting of your play was up to snuff,

Amidst the sombre spires and hunter's game,

For that which glittered in your hand before
You may now find a-twinkling in your back."

Malgré la qualité de l'intrigue de sa pièce,

Pourraient bien finir plantées dans votre dos. »

languages.text:
{n}Al ver a Marazhai, el Arlequín suelta una risita desagradable:{/n}
«¡El artero atrapado en sus propias artimañas!
La trama de tu obra estaba a la altura,
pero Nazrakhei reescribió el desenlace,
decidido en la oscuridad de las alas.
Entre las sombrías vicisitudes y la caza del cazador,
es de sabios detenerse y comprobar una vez más tus cuchillos...
Porque en lo que antes brillaba en tu mano...
ahora puede entrañar un tintineo en tu espalda».
languages.original_text:
{n}At the sight of Marazhai, the Harlequin lets out a nasty chuckle:{/n}
"The trapper caught in snares of his own make!
The plotting of your play was up to snuff,

For that which glittered in your hand before
You may now find a-twinkling in your back."

languages.text:
{n}Als er Marazhai sieht, stößt der Harlekin ein böses Lachen aus:{/n}
"Unser Trapper sitzt in seiner Falle!
Wohl durchdacht war die Geschichte des Stücks,
Bis Nazrakhei ein neues Ende schrieb.
Beschlossen im Dunkel der Schwingen.
Inmitten dunkler Türme und Ränke
Ein Blick auf Eure Messer wäre klug,
Denn was einst in Euren Händen glänzte,
Findet leicht einen Weg in den Rücken."
languages.original_text:
{n}At the sight of Marazhai, the Harlequin lets out a nasty chuckle:{/n}
"The trapper caught in snares of his own make!

languages.text:
{n}Arleken, Marazhai'ı görür görmez nahoş bir şekilde kıkırdıyor.{/n}
"Tuzaklar kuran düşmüş kendi tuzağına,
Oyununda yatan komploları yazmış bir kenara.
Lakin Nazrakhei yazmış baştan hikâyenin sonunu,
Kanatların altındaki karanlıkta varmış karara.
Kasvetli kulelerin ve avcının oyununun ortasında,
Durup bıçaklarına göz gezdirmek pek akıllıca.
Zira evvelden avucunda parıl parıl parlayan
Hiç beklemediğin bir anda beliriverir sırtında."
languages.original_text:
{n}At the sight of Marazhai, the Harlequin lets out a nasty chuckle:{/n}
"The trapper caught in snares of his own make!
